verses.text: And on the fifth day, Peter sat with Clement and said: 'My son, let us speak of the mystery of the Beloved, how He who is the Word of the Father came down to dwell among the children of men.'
'He who established the heavens by His command took upon Himself the form of a servant, and He who clotheth the lilies of the field was wrapped in swaddling clothes.'
'This is the great humility of our God, that He should visit His creation in such a lowly estate, to show us the path of meekness which leadeth to the kingdom.'
'For the pride of Adam was the cause of our fall, but the humility of Christ is the cause of our rising again.'
Peter spake regarding the dual nature of the Savior: 'Understand, Clement, that He is both the Son of God and the Son of Man; God in His power and Man in His suffering.'
'As God, He commanded the winds and they obeyed Him; as Man, He wept at the grave of His friend.'
'As God, He multiplied the bread for the multitude; as Man, He hungered in the desert.'
'He united the earthly with the heavenly in His own person, that we might be joined to the Father through His flesh and His blood.'
And regarding the disciples of the Lord, Peter said: 'The Lord chose not only the Twelve to be with Him, but He also appointed Seventy and Two others and sent them before His face.'
'He gave them power to heal the sick and to cast out demons, and He commanded them to speak of the peace which passeth all understanding.'
'For the harvest is great and the laborers are few, and the word of the kingdom must reach every corner of the earth.'
'Be thou also a laborer in this vineyard, and let thy life be a testimony to the power of the Gospel.'
Peter spake of the armor of the Spirit: 'Since we wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against the hidden powers of wickedness, let us put on the armor which the Lord hath provided.'
'Let truth be thy belt and righteousness thy breastplate, and let thy feet be shod with the preparation of the gospel of peace.'
'Above all, take the shield of faith, wherewith thou shalt be able to quench all the fiery darts of the wicked one.'
'For he who is armed with the grace of God can stand against the whole world, and he shall not be moved.'
Finally, Peter said: 'My son, keep these words in thy mind and do not let them depart from thy heart.'
'For the time is coming when the love of many shall wax cold, and the knowledge of these mysteries shall be hidden from the eyes of the worldly.'
'But to thee it is given to know the secrets of the kingdom, that thou mayest be a light in the midst of a crooked generation.'
'And may the peace of God, which passeth all understanding, keep thy heart and mind through Christ Jesus. Amen.'
